text.#text: There is established the
The Commission shall be composed of 8 members, of whom—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Majority Leader of the Senate

text.#text: 2 members shall be appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: 2 members shall be appointed by the

text.#text: 2 members shall be appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: minority leader of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Minority Leader of the House of Representatives

text.#text: 2 members shall be appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
from among individuals, or
			 representatives of institutions or entities, who possess—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

text.#text: Members of the Commission shall be appointed to the

a demonstrated commitment to the research, study, or promotion of women's history, art, political
			 or economic status, or culture; and
expertise in museum administration;
expertise in fundraising for nonprofit or cultural institutions;
experience in the study and teaching of women’s history;

experience in studying the issue of the representation of women in art, life, history, and culture
			 at the
extensive experience in public or elected service;
experience in the administration of, or the planning for, the establishment of, museums; or
experience in the planning, design, or construction of museum facilities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

shall be appointed not later than the date that is 90 days
			 after the date of enactment of this Act.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report containing the recommendations
			 of the

with respect to a plan of action for the establishment
			 and maintenance of a National Women’s History Museum in Washington, DC.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women’s History Museum

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report that addresses the following
			 issues:

text.#text: The
The availability and cost of collections to be acquired and housed in the Museum.
The impact of the Museum on regional women history-related museums.
Potential locations for the Museum in Washington, DC, and its environs.
Whether the Museum should be part of the
The governance and organizational structure from which the Museum should operate.
Best practices for engaging women in the development and design of the Museum.
The cost of constructing, operating, and maintaining the Museum.
